15.heading: NBA.
15.title: Girl Got Game
15.author: by Shizuru Seino ; translator, Aya Matsunaga ; English adaptation, Kelly Sue DeConnick.
notes: First published in Japan by Kodansha, Ltd., Tokyo, 2000.

Summary (from OCLC): Kyo Aizawa is a teenage girl who just wants to live a normal teenage life, but her father, who used to be a basketball player and wanted to make it to the NBA, is now determined to live his dreams through his daughter. She finds out that her father registered her as a boy and cooked up a scheme so that she would play on the boys basketball team and become the basketball player he always wanted to be.

40.heading: NBM Publishing.
40.title: Arlene's Heart
40.author: by Victoria Frances ; translated by Oscar Rodriguez.
notes: Alternates images with blocks of text, about mastectomy.

41.heading: NBM Publishing.
41.title: Artifice. Maximum
41.author: Jean David Morvan, writer ; Philippe Buchet, artist ; translation by Joe Johnson.
notes: Original titles: Sillage 6: Artifices, and Sillage 7: Q H I.

"In Artifice, feisty human agent Navee falls on a planet persecuted by a ruling class with little regard for life. She faces her coldest rival ever. In Maximum (In)security, she is given the task of dismantling a ring trafficking in planets but to do so she must retrieve Rib'Wund, a mercenary she worked with already, out of a maximum security prison filled with ultra violent inmates. We also get to find out how she got those white bands across her body."

42.heading: NBM Publishing.
42.title: Astronauts of the Future
42.author: Lewis Trondheim, Manu Larcenet ; translation by Joe Johnson.
42.genre: Funny kid and science fiction genres.
notes: Translation of: Les Cosmonautes du Futur.

43.heading: NBM Publishing.
43.title: The Beast of Chicago : an Account of the Life and Crimes of Herman W. Mudgett, Known to the World as H.H. Holmes
43.author: written and illustrated by Rick Geary.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): An account of the life and grisly career of Dr. Herman W. Mudgett, the serial murderer better known as H.H. Holmes, particularly focusing on his life in Chicago, where he was responsible for an unknown number of deaths in the late 1800's.

44.heading: NBM Publishing.
44.title: Between the Devil & Miles Davis
44.author: Lance Tooks.
notes: "The 4th and final volume in this quartet, bringing together all the elements that run through this series. Amo is a hardened journalist who smokes and drinks too much, though not nearly enough for her own taste. Assigned to profile the late jazz legend Miles Davis, she finds herself in a creative impasse. How does one approach such an "overly-written-about' artist from a fresh angle, and what's her opinion worth anyway in a world so fast unraveling? At her wit's end, she stumbles into the mysterous 'Smokeasy,' the only bar in Manhattan where adults are allowed to behave as such, and it is in that misty room that Amo falls under the spell of a mysterious bartender."

45.heading: NBM Publishing.
45.title: The Blue Notebook
45.author: André Juillard ; translation by Jacinthe Leclerc ; lettering by Compudesign.

47.title: The Book of Schuiten

notes: "This book concentrates principally on his work outside of comics, presenting pieces never before seen in the U.S."

60.heading: NBM Publishing.
60.title: Daily Delirium
60.author: M
60.appears_in: Prado ; translation by Robert Legault & Miguel Guerra.
notes: "The complete collection of outrageous gags, many seen in Heavy Metal."

61.heading: NBM Publishing.
61.title: Darlin' Niki
61.author: Lance Tooks.
notes: "Niki has been turned out into the street by her powerful philanthropist father. She seeks a resolution to their endless conflict and, with the help of childhood friend Sussudio, tries to crash a massive corporate banquet in his honor. Niki, a willful first-born teenager is unable to abide by her father's strict and often contradictory rules. Her father spends a lot of his valuable time and money helping others as he sees fit, yet refusing to see his daughter as anything more than a company mascot. He now considers her to be too much trouble, perhaps forgetting that she is as he made her."

64.heading: NBM Publishing.
64.title: Dinosaurs Across America
64.author: by Phil Yeh.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Presents information about the fifty states through a fictional story in comics format about a rabbit named Patrick who bets a group of time-traveling dinosaurs that he knows more about geography than they do.

Summary (from SkyRiver): The magic of the Louvre melds with ethereal storytelling in this tale of a museum director in a waking dream after his retirement dinner, in which he wanders the vast halls before eloping with a muse.

91.title: The Lindbergh Child : the Atrocious Kidnapping and Murder of the Infant Son of America's Hero Col. Charles A. Lindbergh
91.author: written and illustrated by Rick Geary.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): All was well for Charles Lindbergh, after his daring solo crossing of the Atlantic. Fame and fortune came quickly. Soon after the Lindbergh's build themselves their dream home far from the madding crowd, tragedy strikes

95.title: Malefic
95.author: Luis Royo ; translation by Robert Legault.

96.heading: NBM Publishing.
96.title: Minimum Security
96.author: Stephanie McMillan ; edited by Ted Rall.

97.heading: NBM Publishing.
97.title: Miss DD
97.author: Chiyoji ; translation by Miguel Guerra.
notes: "An erotic Japanese manga by way of" Spain's Kiss Cómix.

98.heading: NBM Publishing.
98.title: Miss Don't Touch Me
98.author: story and color, Hubert ; art, Kerascoët ; translation by Joe Johnson.
notes: "Initially published in French as La Vierge du Bordel and Du Sang sur les Mains."

Summary (from back cover): "It's the turn of the XXth century. The 'Butcher of the Dances' is on the prowl for young loose women. Florence has no family and works as a maid. Her only friend and thus family is her fellow maid, fun-loving Agatha, and Florences loses her to what she saw was murder but others only see as suicide. She decides to take matters into her own hands. In her pursuit, she ends up a servant in a luxury house of call-girls. She even becomes quite good at certain lascivious practices while still remaining a virgin. But she also doesn't lose sight of her goal: Find the Butcher."

100.heading: NBM Publishing.
100.title: Mister O
100.author: Lewis Trondheim.
notes: Silent one-page strips showing Mister O, a round doodle of a man desperately trying to get across a chasm and never quite making it.

101.heading: NBM Publishing.
101.title: Moresukine : Uploaded Weekly from Tokyo
101.author: Dirk Schwieger.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): In order to help immerse himself in Japanese culture during a six-month period he spent living abroad in Tokyo (Jan. 2-July 3 2006), German comic artist Dirk Schwieger kept a weekly webcomic blog on which he asked his fans to dare him to try all sorts of different things

exotic, disgusting, revealing, whatever! This book documents the results of that project in a blend that is part travelogue and part graphic novel. In addition to completing his own assignments, Schwieger sent messages to other comic artists around the globe asking them to meet and talk with Japanese people living in their respective cities and to document these conversations. The book also features comics detailing the results of these efforts from participants including James Kochalka, Steve Havelka, Leo Leowald, Ryan North, Olivier Texier, Monsieur Le Chien, Thomas Gilke, Yassine & Toma Bletner, and Marcel Guldemond.

102.heading: NBM Publishing.
102.title: The Murder of Abraham Lincoln : a Chronicle of 62 Days in the Life of the American Republic, March 4-May 4, 1865
102.author: written and illustrated by Rick Geary.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): A fictionalized account of the conspiracy by John Wilkes Booth and other Confederate sympathizers to strike out at the Executive Branch of the United States government that resulted in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln and the subsequent actions of the government to round up the conspirators.

103.heading: NBM Publishing.
103.title: The Museum Vaults : Excerpts from the Journal of an Expert
103.author: Marc-Antoine Mathieu.
notes: Published in conjunction with the Louvre museum.
Summary (from SkyRiver): An art assessor finds himself drawn into a seemingly endless succession of basement levels when he sets out to evaluate the warehoused collection at Paris's Louvre Museum.
Translation of: Les Sous-Sols du Révolu.

104.heading: NBM Publishing.
104.title: The Night Shirt
104.author: ; Christophe Blain, art ; Joann Sfar, Lewis Trondheim, story ; translated by Joe Johnson.
notes: Translation of: Donjon Potron-Minet -99 : La Chemise de Nuit.

106.heading: NBM Publishing.
106.title: No Exit
106.author: Andy Singer ; edited by Ted Rall.

107.heading: NBM Publishing.
107.title: Nocturnal Conspiracies : Nineteen Dreams, from December 1979 to September 1994
107.author: David B ; translation by Joe Johnson ; lettering by Ortho.

108.heading: NBM Publishing.
108.title: The 1001 Nights of Scheherazade
108.author: Eric Maltaite ; translation by Joe Johnson ; lettering by Ortho.
notes: Translation of: Les 1001 Nuits de Schéhérazade.

109.heading: NBM Publishing.
109.title: Ordinary Victories
109.author: Manu Larcenet ; colors by Patrice Larcenet ; translation by Joe Johnson.

110.heading: NBM Publishing.
110.title: Orient Gateway
110.author: Vittorio Giardino ; translated by Jeff Lisle ; edited by Bernd Metz.

111.heading: NBM Publishing.
111.title: The Palace of a Thousand Pleasures
111.author: Colin Murray.

113.heading: NBM Publishing.
113.title: Private Collection
113.author: by Jean David Morvan, writer ; Philippe Buchet, artist ; translation by Joe Johnson ; lettering by Ortho.

114.heading: NBM Publishing.
114.title: Rumble Girls : Silky Warrior Tansie
114.author: Lea Hernandez.
notes: "Raven Tansania Ransom is a promising pilot-in-training of personal armor known as Hardskin, at exclusive girl's school academie Juliet. Carmen Cameron, another pilot-in-training, reveals to the school Raven's shady background, making her the butt of gossip and cruel pranks. Raven challenges Carmen to full-Hardskin combat, not knowing Carmen's fixing the fight. Raven's coach, who is also sexy media celebrity pilot Crimson August, faces a crisis as well: his popularity is slipping, leading the suits to give him a new rival. Someone young, innocent and female. Someone very much like Raven."

115.heading: NBM Publishing.
115.title: Run, Bong-gu, Run! : a Little Manhwa Graphic Novel
115.author: by Byun Byung Jun ; translation by Joe Johnson.
notes: "Off the train in the middle of winter at the station in Seoul, Bong-gu and his mother bring a little spring time warmth to the capital. They're from a poor isolated area but on the beautiful sea. She's looking for her kid's dad who left without a trace. An old man meets the kid and actually remembers seeing his dad. He manages to bring them together. Dad had dreams coming from the country, hitting the big city. They didn't quite work out. He had become too ashamed to show himself again. From desperation, the outcome of this story, however, will bring warmth to any heart, showing that the hope and love of humanity can melt the cold indifference of our urban societies."

116.heading: NBM Publishing.
116.title: The Saga of the Bloody Benders : the Infamous Homicidal Family of Labette County, Kansas
116.author: written and illustrated by Rick Geary.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): The story of a family of serial killers who owned a small general store and inn in Labette County, Kansas, from 1872 to 1873.

118.heading: NBM Publishing.
118.title: The Sign of the Demons
118.author: Jean-David Morvan, writer ; Philippe Buchet, artist ; translation by Joe Johnson ; lettering by Ortho.
notes: The second half of this vol., pt. 5 of the story, is titled in an alien alphabet, for which transliteration is not given.
Translation of: Sillage 4: Le Signe des Démons, and Sillage 5: Jvsz.

119.heading: NBM Publishing.
119.title: The Sky over the Louvre
119.author: Bernar Yslaire, Jean-Claude Carriere.
notes: Translation of Le Ciel au-dessus du Louvre.

120.heading: NBM Publishing.
120.title: The Speed Abater
120.author: Christophe Blain ; translation by Joe Johnson.
notes: Translation of: Le Réducteur de Vitesse.

122.heading: NBM Publishing.
122.title: The Student
122.author: Lance Tooks.
122.series: or Nude Descending a Staircase, Head First
notes: "Inspired by the German silent film classic "The Student of Prague," this is the story of Andre Baldwin, a down-on-his-luck would-be Basquiat who enters into a Faustian bargain with a powerful art critic in exchange for status, riches and the love of a woman. Acquanetta Scapinelli is the critic in question, and she recounts this bitter tale with sardonic delight. For what shall it profit a man if he gain the whole world and lose his own soul?"

123.heading: NBM Publishing.
123.title: Suburban Nightmares : The Science Experiment
123.author: by Larry Hancock, Michael Cherkas, John Van Bruggen.

124.heading: NBM Publishing.
124.title: Swann in Love
124.author: Marcel Proust ; adapted by Stephane Heuet.
notes: Vol. 1 of Swann in Love is numbered Part 3, vol. 1 of Remembrance of Things Past, and is also number 4 (spine numbering) of Remembrance of Things Past.

125.heading: NBM Publishing.
125.title: The Terrible Axe-Man of New Orleans
125.author: music and lyrics by Rick Geary.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): As the Jazz Age dawned in rollicking New Orleans, an unknown assailant targeted immigrants, mostly of Italian origin, broke into their homes and brutally assaulted them, resulting in grievous injury and several corpses. Clues are sparse; the police are baffled; and the general populace is thrown into a vortex of paranoia.

126.heading: NBM Publishing.
126.title: The 3rd Degree.
126.author: [No author]
notes: New York : Red Sky Publishing ; NBM, .

127.heading: NBM Publishing.
127.title: Trailers
127.author: Mark Kneece, Julie Collins-Rousseau.
notes: "Josh Clayton's mother has killed a man and left Josh in charge of disposing of the body. The trouble is, the body will not stay put. From dogs to low-life trailer park denizens, Josh's life slips even more deeply into hell as he attempts to keep the corpse under wraps. Josh, a sensitive teenager, attempts to persevere in the face of a morbid dilemma: guilt and fear over the crime conflict with his reluctant devotion to his mother. In the meantime he has the additional task of taking care of his younger brothers and sister while enduring the ordinary minefield known as high school. As presure on Josh builds to critical mass, he suddenly finds himself involved in a relationship with Michelle. She tries to understand him, and to her credit, she almost does. Josh is forced to take a difficult stand against his own mother or never be able to move on. By two memebers of the faculty of sequential art at the Savannah College of Art & Design."

129.heading: NBM Publishing.
129.title: What is Precious
129.author: by Manu Larcenet.
notes: "Marco comes to terms with having a child, the loss of his father and their relationship, his mother living alone, a man dying in the countryside, a journalist cracking under pressure. The final part of this moving story about small things, rare moments, banal sadness and an ordinary guy who's just trying to live the best way he can."

130.heading: NBM Publishing.
130.title: Within a Budding Grove
